definition: ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent
to overflow/(literary) excessive/old variant of 鎰|镒[yi4]

sentences.english: This brilliant engineer and droid technician operated out of the Minos Cluster.
sentences.chinese: 這位才華橫溢的機器人工程技師在米諾斯星團外工作。

sentences.english: Hemingway is a writer of remarkable genius.
sentences.chinese: 海明威是才華橫溢的作家。

sentences.english: He was not only very talented, but also very upright.
sentences.chinese: 他不但才華橫溢，而且爲人耿直。

sentences.english: Jackie was running around with all these brilliant people.
sentences.chinese: 傑姬混跡於這些才華橫溢的人之間。

sentences.english: "Cori is talented beyond thinking like a worm, " Dr.
sentences.chinese: 葛利不僅愛思考，更是才華橫溢。

sentences.english: A Xin is not only handsome, but also talented.
sentences.chinese: 阿信，不但擁有帥氣的外表，而且才華橫溢。

sentences.english: Regardless of the genius of the novelists readers become less and less interested in pure literature.
sentences.chinese: 儘管小說家才華橫溢，然而純文學的讀者越來越少。

sentences.english: I have been lucky to be able to work with many talented coauthors.
sentences.chinese: 我非常有幸能與諸多才華橫溢的學者共事。

sentences.english: There are many smart and talented people inside Microsoft who know what to do.
sentences.chinese: 微軟公司裏還有很多才華橫溢的聰明人知道該怎樣做。

sentences.english: She is a prodigiously talented pianist.
sentences.chinese: 她是才華橫溢的鋼琴家。

sentences.english: They have been brilliant before. Exciting, fast-breaking and smooth.
sentences.chinese: 他們一直是一支才華橫溢的球隊，興奮。

sentences.english: I have never seen such a talented man as he is.
sentences.chinese: 我從來沒有見過象他這樣才華橫溢的人。

sentences.english: But she thinks she is like the most talented kid in the school.
sentences.chinese: 但她覺得她就是這學校最才華橫溢得人。

sentences.english: She loved his brilliance and his generous heart.
sentences.chinese: 她深愛他的才華橫溢和古道熱腸。

definition: to surpass others/outstanding/(basketball, soccer etc) to get past an opponent
lit. not a common chord (idiom); outstanding/brilliant/out of the common run
lit. burn your hand, feel the heat (idiom)/fig. arrogance of the powerful/a mighty figure no-one dares approach/hot (exciting or in favor)
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
